content.description: This is a short problem with fun moves on great holds. The topout is delightfully solid. The only thing taking away from the quality is the proximity of the large boulder on the left.
content.protection: 2 crashpads, mainly to protect falling backwards onto the neighboring boulder.
content.location: Just right of center, SDS using a couple of dish-like holds that are about shoulder width apart. Move up and link to the lip using one of the nicest incut crimps you’ll find anywhere, then top out.

content.description: This unassuming trailside boulder hosts a nice little overhang that’s completely hidden when passing by on the trail. The rock quality is a little grainy but is nice and solid.
